intro: Cyperorchis lowiana, commonly known as the Low's sedge orchid, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, delicate orchid-like flowers in shades of white and purple. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and wetlands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
